question_text: A laptop technician reroutes antenna cables away from the screen to simplify reassembly. What is the most likely outcome?
answer_options: Improved wireless bandwidth due to reduced cable tension
Increased laptop airflow and better cooling
Weaker wireless performance due to poor antenna elevation
No noticeable impact unless BIOS is updated
correct_answer: Weaker wireless performance due to poor antenna elevation
explanation: Antenna placement near the screen improves elevation and reception. Rerouting them elsewhere will reduce signal quality.
